page.title: 20HORNER WOODS
page.content: The most important woods on the Holnicote Estate in terms of natural history and wildlife conservation are the{oakwoods of the Horner and East {Water}valleys,the steepsided combes running southwards towards Dunkery Beacon from Horner Green.The whole area is scheduled as a{Site of Special {Scientific Interest,}and the National Trust is taking particular care to mainrain the woods as oakwoods in perpetuity.The mixture of ancient oak {high forest}on the lower sheltered ground and{oak coppice}on the hgher slopes reminds us of days when the woods were the source of products such as building timbers,charcoal and tan- bark essential to the{rural economy.} Now their value lies in ecological diversity and shelter for many birds and animals notably red deer.
